title: got into a game and now I can't reconnect!
body:
I was just queuing for a draft pick when I got into the actual match, and then it disconnected me from the game

I'm receiving continuous reconnect buttons etc. they won't give me the matchmaking page with champions at all.

I've closed all other applications, ran two full system repairs.

Every time I press reconnect, it just says game loading and instantly springs back to reconnect.

I've turned off my anti-virus and firewall as well just to see if that was what was blocking the connection, I'm certain it's not my ethernet connection either since I'm able to run web pages fine.

replies.body:
Hey there,

Could you please do the following for me;

* [Switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the direct url to your ICSI netalyzr results.
jokes its happening again right now when I launched a ranked game
nevermind I found a forum post about connecting to googles dns server and that fixed the issue :)

I've also tried giving this method a shot:

C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_game_client\releases\0.0.0.185\deploy
 find your "League of Legends.exe" then right click it, press properties then go to "Details" and finally check if in the version box you have these numbers "3.13.0.399" if not delete the file and repair the client again
